questions.question: Question 1: Which of the following would you advise as the best approach to control arthropods?
questions.explanation: Environmental control is the best approach to control arthropods. The principles of arthropod control include: • Environmental control - Best approach • Chemical control - Use of insecticides, pesticides, etc. • Biological control - Use of larvivorous fish like Gambusia • Genetic control • Newer methods - • Chemosterilants • Insect growth regulators • Sex attractants • Integrated approach involves usage of more than one modality of arthropod control

questions.question: Question 2: Which of the following is the best method to control houseflies?
questions.explanation:
659 
Sold by @itachibot The best method to control houseflies is environmental control by the elimination of breeding 
places. They have shown resistance to a number of insecticides, including DDT.

questions.question: Question 3: Which of the following is not an organo-phosphate insecticide?
questions.explanation:
Dieldrin is an organo-chlorine insecticide. It is a broad-spectrum insecticide that acts as a contact, 
stomach, and inhalation poison.

questions.question: Question 4: Which of the following is not an aryl organo-phosphate insecticide?
questions.explanation:
Malathion is an alkyl organophosphate insecticide. It is used as an ultra-low volume spray in 
mosquito control.

questions.question: Question 5: Which of the following insecticides is least toxic to man?
questions.explanation:
Among the given options, malathion is the least toxic to man. It is the least toxic 
organo-phosphate insecticide.

questions.question: Question 6: Which of the following is false about fenthion?

options.a: It is used as a residual spray
options.b: It is used as a repellent

questions.explanation:
Fenthion is not used as a repellant. A commonly used repellant is N,N-diethyl-m-toluamide 
(DEET) that is used for protection from mosquitoes and ticks. Fenthion is a broad-spectrum insecticide that acts as both contact and stomach poison. It is used 
as a larvicide in mosquito control and also as a residual spray.

questions.question: Question 7: Which of the following is false about pyrethrum?

options.a: Residual action as good as DDT
options.d: Can be used synergistically with DDT

questions.explanation:
Pyrethrum does not have a residual action like DDT or other synthetic insecticides. So, most space 
sprays contain pyrethrum and DDT for synergistic action. Pyrethrum is a natural insecticide of vegetable origin. It is extracted from the flowers of 
Chrysanthemum cinerariafolium. It kills adult mosquitoes and other insects instantly on mere 
contact.

questions.question: Question 8: Which of the following cannot be used to describe pyrethrum?
questions.explanation:
660 
Sold by @itachibot Pyrethrum is not used as a residual spray. It is a contact and nerve poison that is also used as a 
space spray.

questions.question: Question 9: Which of the following is a synthetic pyrethroid insecticide?
questions.explanation:
Permethrin is a synthetic pyrethroid. Pyrethroids are synthetic insecticides, which are derived 
from naturally occurring pyrethrins. Pyrethroids modify the sodium channels in neuronal 
membranes and thereby disrupt the electrical signalling in the nervous system.

questions.question:
Question 10: Which of the following vectors has not shown resistance to synthetic pyrethroids, in a 
widespread manner in India yet?
questions.explanation:
Sandflies (Phlebotomus) have not shown resistance to synthetic pyrethroids, in a widespread 
manner in India yet.

questions.question: Question 11: Which of the following best describes DDT?
questions.explanation:
DDT is a contact poison that belongs to the organochlorine family. It has been widely used but a 
number of organisms have become resistant to its effects now.

questions.question:
Question 12: During a dengue outbreak, the municipal corporation plans a DDT spraying initiative. Which 
of the following is false about this insecticide?

options.a: Para-para isomer is the most active fraction
options.c: It has residual action up to 18 months
options.d: It causes immediate death of insects

questions.explanation:
DDT does not cause the immediate death of insects. It takes several hours for its action to be 
complete. It contains 70 – 80% of para-para isomer that is the most active fraction of DDT. It acts on the 
nervous system of insects. The residual action of DDT may last as long as 18 months depending 
upon the treated surface.

questions.question: Question 13: Which of the following is true about the usage of Paris green for mosquito control?

options.c: Harmful in normal doses to man and animals

questions.explanation:
Paris green is very effective against surface-feeding Anopheles. It is an anti-larval measure and is a stomach poison. It is not harmful in normal doses to man and 
animals.

questions.question:
Question 14: Which of the following mosquitoes can be controlled by destroying aquatic plants with 
herbicides?
questions.explanation:
Mansonia mosquitoes breed in water with aquatic vegetation, and destroying this vegetation with 
herbicides would control this mosquito. 661 
Sold by @itachibot

questions.question: Question 15: Which of the following is not a mosquito anti-larval measure?
questions.explanation: Pyrethrum is an anti-adult measure and not an anti-larval measure. Mineral oils, Gambusia, and Paris green are anti-larval measures used in mosquito control.

questions.question: Question 16: Which among the following insecticides is most widely used as a space spray?
questions.explanation: The insecticide most widely used as a space spray is pyrethrum.

questions.question: Question 17: Match the following methods of mosquito control to the appropriate examples.

options.a: I – a, II – b, III – c, IV – d
options.b: I – b, II – d, III – c, IV – a
options.c: I – c, II – a, III – b, IV – d
options.d: I – d, II – b, III – a, IV – c

questions.explanation:
The correctly matched methods of mosquito control are: Method of control 
Example Biological control 
Barbados millio 
ns Genetic control 
Sex distortion Chemical control 
Larvicidal oil Environmental contr 
ol Source reductio 
n

questions.question:
Question 18: To curb an outbreak of plague in your locality, the municipal corporation decides to use 
rodenticides. Which of the following can be given as a single dose for this purpose?
questions.explanation:
Zinc phosphide is a single-dose rodenticide that causes death in a one-time exposure. Acute or single-dose rodenticides are classified according to the precautions that need to be taken 
before their use: • Those requiring ordinary care - Red squill, norbormide, zinc phosphide • Those requiring maximal precaution - Sodium fluoroacetate, fluoroacetamide and strychnine • Too dangerous for use - Arsenic trioxide, phosphorus, thallium sulphate Multiple-dose or cumulative rodenticides cause death after multiple times of exposure. Examples 
include: • Warfarin • Coumafuryl • Diphacinone 662 
Sold by @itachibot • Pindone

questions.question: Question 19: Which of the following color labels is used to indicate the most hazardous pesticides?
questions.explanation:
The most hazardous pesticides must have labels in red color. Pesticide toxicity labels: These labels are depicted in the image below. Category of Pesticid 
e Color of Lab 
el Extremely toxic 
Bright red Highly toxic 
Bright yello 
w Moderately toxic 
Bright blue Slightly toxic 
Bright green 663 
Sold by @itachibot Biomedical Waste Management
